channel.title: Today's Middle Level Educator
channel.copyright: Copyright 2007-2010 by National Middle School Association
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast series from National Middle School Association
channel.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
channel.itunes:summary: Today's Middle Level Educator, a podcast series produced by National Middle School Association, is the place to hear conversations, interviews, and commentaries from middle level practitioners, leaders, and experts.
channel.description: Today's Middle Level Educator, a podcast series produced by National Middle School Association, is the place to hear conversations, interviews, and commentaries from middle level practitioners, leaders, and experts.
channel.itunes:keywords: nmsa, middle school, middle level, middle grades, young adolescents, education, teaching, teachers, principals

item.title: Active Learning for the Creative Classroom
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Mary Henton, manager of the Middle School Portal Two, talks with Cally Stockton, author of Minds and Motion: Active Learning for the Classroom.
item.itunes:summary: They discuss various activities from the book Minds and Motion: Active Learning for the Creative Classroom.
item.description: Mary Henton, manager of the Middle School Portal Two, talks with Cally Stockton, author of Minds and Motion: Active Learning for the Classroom.
item.itunes:keywords: Minds and Motion, middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, Cally Stockton, student motivation, motivate students, active learning, classroom activities

item.title: Motivating Young Adolescents
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for NMSA, is joined by Kim Campbell, classroom teacher and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre. Jack and Kim share ideas about student motivation and the role of the classroom teacher.
item.itunes:summary: They discuss practical ways to motivate the young adolescent.
item.description: Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for NMSA, is joined by Kim Campbell, classroom teacher and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre. Jack and Kim share ideas about student motivation and the role of the classroom teacher. They discuss practical ways to motivate the young adolescent.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, Kim Campbell, student motivation, motivate students, motivate young adolescents, classroom motivation

item.title: Building Positive Relationships with Your Students
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for NMSA, and Howard Ormond, principal and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre, for a discussion on specific strategies to motivate young adolescents.
item.itunes:summary: They examine the importance of building positive relationships with your students and how teachers can truly impact the lives of young adolescents.
item.description: Join Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for NMSA, and Howard Ormond, principal and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre, for a discussion on specific strategies to motivate young adolescents. They examine the importance of building positive relationships with your students and how teachers can truly impact the lives of young adolescents.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, Howard Ormond, student motivation, relationships with your students, teacher

item.title: School Uniforms: Jeans or Jackets?
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: The impact of school uniforms is an issue that affects schools, parents, and students alike. Join Jack Berckemeyer, NMSA assistant executive director, and Ms. Ernie Rambo as they focus on this timely topic.
item.itunes:summary: Ernie is a classroom teacher in Las Vegas, Nevada, and has been directly involved with the implications of the uniform issue. Jack and Ernie examine the advantages and disadvantages of school uniforms and talk about questions the teachers might have regarding the uniform issue and how to address students concerns.
item.description: The impact of school uniforms is an issue that affects schools, parents, and students alike. Join Jack Berckemeyer, NMSA assistant executive director, and Ms. Ernie Rambo as they focus on this timely topic. Ernie is a classroom teacher in Las Vegas, Nevada, and has been directly involved with the implications of the uniform issue. Jack and Ernie examine the advantages and disadvantages of school uniforms and talk about questions the teachers might have regarding the uniform issue and how to address students concerns.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, Ernie Rambo, uniforms, school uniforms

item.title: Connecting the Dots - NMSA09 Preview
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director of NMSA, talks with Rita Pierson about her upcoming speech at the NMSA09 Annual Conference in Indianapolis, Indiana.
item.itunes:summary: Rita shares her thoughts on what topics she will cover as the Teacher Luncheon speaker. Rita's vast knowledge in staff motivation, poverty issues, and school climate make Rita a must hear speaker.
item.description: Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director of NMSA, talks with Rita Pierson about her upcoming speech at the NMSA09 Annual Conference in Indianapolis, Indiana. Rita shares her thoughts on what topics she will cover as the Teacher Luncheon speaker. Rita's vast knowledge in staff motivation, poverty issues, and school climate make Rita a must hear speaker.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, Rita Pierson, nmsa09

item.title: The Culture of Formative Assessment
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: In this second part of a two-part discussion about formative assessment, Kate Garrison, Manager of Products and services for Professional Development with Measured Progress, discusses the culture of formative assessment.
item.itunes:summary: In this second part of a two-part discussion about formative assessment, Kate Garrison, Manager of Products and services for Professional Development with Measured Progress, discusses the culture of formative assessment.
item.description: In this second part of a two-part discussion about formative assessment, Kate Garrison, Manager of Products and services for Professional Development with Measured Progress, discusses the culture of formative assessment.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, education, formative assessment, Cate Garrison, Catherine Garrison, assessment, summative assessment, classroom assessment

item.title: The Evolution of Advisory
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Bob Spear and Jack Berckemeyer discuss the importance of advisory in the middle school.
item.itunes:summary: They also examine how advisory has changed over the last several years with the impact of the No Child Left Behind Act and other mandates. This episode provides schools and individuals with a sense of understanding the importance a quality advisory program brings to any great middle school.
item.description: Bob Spear and Jack Berckemeyer discuss the importance of advisory in the middle school. They also examine how advisory has changed over the last several years with the impact of the No Child Left Behind Act and other mandates. This episode provides schools and individuals with a sense of understanding the importance a quality advisory program brings to any great middle school.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Bob Spear, advisory, advisory programs

item.title: Single Sex Classrooms
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Ever wonder about the issues regarding the single sex classroom? Jack Berckemeyer, National Middle School Association assistant executive director, and Judith Baenen, editor of NMSA's The Family Connection, take on this hot topic!
item.itunes:summary: Judith shares her knowledge of the single sex classroom and why it has become such a huge issue. The conversation also examines the differences between how girls learn versus boys and what teachers can do to address those distinctions.
item.description: Ever wonder about the issues regarding the single sex classroom? Jack Berckemeyer, National Middle School Association assistant executive director, and Judith Baenen, editor of NMSA's The Family Connection and member of the Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre, take on this hot topic! Judith shares her knowledge of the single sex classroom and why it has become such a huge issue. The conversation also examines the differences between how girls learn versus boys and what teachers can do to address those distinctions.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Judith Baenen, classroom, single sex classroom, gender

item.title: The Students are SOAR-ing
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Kim Campbell, a classroom teacher and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Cadre, talks about the SOAR program with NMSA's Assistant Executive Director, Jack Berckemeyer.
item.itunes:summary: The SOAR program has been used at Kim's school to help deal with the achievement gap. Jack and Kim share practical ways to introduce SOAR and provide concrete examples of the program's impact in the lives of young adolescents.
item.description: Kim Campbell, a classroom teacher and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Cadre, talks about the SOAR program with NMSA's Assistant Executive Director, Jack Berckemeyer. The SOAR program has been used at Kim's school to help deal with the achievement gap. Jack and Kim share practical ways to introduce SOAR and provide concrete examples of the program's impact in the lives of young adolescents.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Kim Campbell, SOAR, achievement gap

item.title: Formative Assessment: Debunking the Myths
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Formative assessment is a verb, not a noun. A process whereby students and teachers maintain ongoing conversation about learning, formative assessment is key to student achievement.
item.itunes:summary: Kate Garrison, manager of products and services for professional development with Measured Progress, debunks 5 myths about formative assessment in the first of this 2-part discussion.
item.description: Formative assessment is a verb, not a noun. A process whereby students and teachers maintain ongoing conversation about learning, formative assessment is key to student achievement. Kate Garrison, manager of products and services for professional development with Measured Progress, debunks 5 myths about formative assessment in the first of this 2-part discussion.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, assessment, formative assessment, student achievement, Catherine Garrison, Kate Garrison

item.title: Student Voice and Student Choice
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association, talks with middle level expert and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre Nancy Doda on the issues of student motivation.
item.itunes:summary: Nancy shares information about the power of student choice and the impact of allowing students to have a voice in the classroom.
item.description: In this episode, Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association, talks with middle level expert and member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre Nancy Doda on the issues of student motivation. Nancy shares information about the power of student choice and the impact of allowing students to have a voice in the classroom.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Nancy Doda, student motivation, student voice, classroom, student involvement, student

item.title: Building Community and Business Relationships
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association, and Dr. Santo Pino as they discuss the importance of community involvement and business partnerships within the school.
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Santo also share ideas on ways to involve businesses in your school and the issues and concerns schools might experience.
item.description: Join Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association, and Dr. Santo Pino as they discuss the importance of community involvement and business partnerships within the school. Jack and Santo also share ideas on ways to involve businesses in your school and the issues and concerns schools might experience.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Santo Pino, community involvement, business partnerships

item.title: Cyber-Citizenship for Young Adolescents
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Jill Spencer, a member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre, has a discussion about cyber citizenship and its issues with Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association.
item.itunes:summary: Jill explains what it means to be a good cyber citizen in today's day and age. She elaborates on appropriate actions for young adolescents when dealing with technology, and shares some great examples for classroom teachers to use.
item.description: Jill Spencer, a member of the NMSA Site-Based Services Speakers Cadre, has a discussion about cyber citizenship and its issues with Jack Berckemeyer, assistant executive director for National Middle School Association. Jill explains what it means to be a good cyber citizen in today's day and age. She elaborates on appropriate actions for young adolescents when dealing with technology, and shares some great examples for classroom teachers to use.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, middle grades, Jill Spencer, cyber-citizenship, cyber citizen, technology

item.title: Voices of Teens: Writers Matter
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael Galbraith and Bob Vogel, authors of the new books Voices of Teens: Writers Matter and Voices of Teens: In Their Own Words tell NMSA director of publications April Tibbles how they engaged, even empowered, students through reflective writing.
item.itunes:summary: Together, Michael and Bob crafted a magical program for the middle school classroom based on Erin Gruwell's Freedom Writer's Diary.
item.description: Michael Galbraith and Bob Vogel, authors of the new books Voices of Teens: Writers Matter and Voices of Teens: In Their Own Words tell NMSA director of publications April Tibbles how they engaged, even empowered, students through reflective writing. item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, writing, voices of teens, Michael Galbraith, Bob Vogel, reflective writing, Freedom Writer's Diary

item.title: Podcasts and the Science Classroom
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Todd Williamson, a 7th grade science teacher who employed student-created podcasts to enrich a science unit on human body systems.
item.itunes:summary: Todd explains how producing the podcasts helped students improve science, literacy, and technology skills and understanding.
item.description: Features Todd Williamson, a 7th grade science teacher who employed student-created podcasts to enrich a science unit on human body systems. Todd explains how producing the podcasts helped students improve science, literacy, and technology skills and understanding.
item.itunes:keywords: middle school, middle level, teacher, students, podcast, classroom technology, technology, Todd Williamson

item.title: Wikis in the Classroom
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Erica Roberts, interviewed by Mary Henton, NMSA director of integrated media initiatives.
item.itunes:summary: When Erica used wikis as the format for an annual social studies curriculum project, her students were engaged and learned.

item.title: Bridge Building with Skype
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Bill Ivey, interviewed by Mary Henton, NMSA director of integrated media initiatives.
item.itunes:summary: Bill tells the story and shares insights about how students in his humanities class, in Massachusetts, used Skype to collaborate and learn with students in New York City.

item.itunes:subtitle: Features three middle school principals taking questions from undergraduate students.

item.title: Understanding Young Adolescents
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Kenneth Brighton, intereviewed by April Tibbles, NMSA director of publications.
item.itunes:summary: A middle school teacher for two decades, Kenneth is currently a professor at Johnson State College specializing in middle level education and adolescent development. This show discusses his book, Coming of Age: The Education & Development of Young Adolescents.

item.title: Pointers for Principals, How to Hire the Best Teachers
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Ed Vittardi, interviewed by Mary Henton, NMSA director of integrated media initiatives.
item.itunes:summary: Ed is currently working with NMSA as a facilitator for the Summer Leadership Institute. He is also a very successful principal in Ohio and serves on the Ohio Middle School Board. He shares his insights about finding and interviewing candidates for teaching positions.

item.itunes:subtitle: Features Santo Pino, interviewed by April Tibbles, NMSA director of publications.
item.itunes:summary: Santo has more than 40 years experience in education at all levels and is a facilitator for the NMSA Leadership Institute. Santo has more than 40 years experience in education at all levels and is a facilitator for the NMSA Leadership Institute. His vast knowledge of middle level issues makes him an excellent resource for invaluable advice for aspiring and experienced principals preparing for an interview.
item.itunes:keywords: Santo Pino, middle school, principal, interview, principal interview, interview tips

item.title: Bloom's Taxonomy in the Classroom
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Sandra Schurr, interviewed by April Tibbles, NMSA director of publications.
item.itunes:summary: Sandra is the director of the National Resource Center for Middle Grades/High School Education at the University of South Florida. Sandra discusses the publication, Ignite Student Intellect and Imagination in Mathematics. Today's show provides practical strategies for bringing rich activities based on Bloom's Taxonomy to the classroom.
item.description: Features Sandra Schurr, interviewed by April Tibbles, NMSA director of publications. Sandra is the director of the National Resource Center for Middle Grades/High School Education at the University of South Florida. Sandra discusses the publication, Ignite Student Intellect and Imagination in Mathematics. Today's show provides practical strategies for bringing rich activities based on Bloom's Taxonomy to the classroom.
item.itunes:keywords: Sandra Schurr, middle school, Bloom's taxonomy, Ignite, classroom activities

item.title: Democratic Classroom
item.itunes:author: National Middle School Association
item.itunes:subtitle: Features Mark Springer and two of his students, interviewed by April Tibble, NMSA Director of Publications.
item.itunes:summary: Mark is a teacher at Radnor Middle School (Radnor, PA) and the author of Soundings: A Democratic, Student-Centered Education. Mark facilitates the development of student-generated, interdisciplinary curriculum.
